content.description: A grocery store received three shipments of bags of cranberries: one from farm A, one from farm B, and one from farm C. The distributions of the weight of a bag are unimodal and symmetric for all three shipments. The number of bags and the mean and standard deviation, in ounces (<math alttext="o z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>oz</mtext></math>), for each shipment are shown in the table.
content.question: Farm Number of Bags Mean (<math alttext="in ounces" overflow="scroll"><mtext>oz</mtext></math>) Standard Deviation (<math alttext="in ounces" overflow="scroll"><mtext>oz</mtext></math>) A <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn></math> <math alttext="16.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>16.0</mn></math> <math alttext="0.5" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.5</mn> </math> B <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn></math> <math alttext="16.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>16.0</mn></math> <math alttext="0.1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn></math> C <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn></math> <math alttext="16.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>16.0</mn></math> <math alttext="0.1" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn></math> Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The shipment from farm A is most likely to have the greatest number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

The shipment from farm B is most likely to have the greatest number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

The shipment from farm C is most likely to have the greatest number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

The shipments from farms B and C are the only shipments that are likely to have an approximately equal number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

The shipments from farms A, B, and C are all likely to have an approximately equal number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

content.answer: The shipments from farms A, B, and C are all likely to have an approximately equal number of bags that weigh less than <math alttext="16 ounces" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>oz</mi></math>.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
